Package project4

Class ArrayMatrix<E>

java.lang.Object
project4.ArrayMatrix<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of elements maintained by this matrix
public class ArrayMatrix<E> extends Object
Represents a two-dimensional array with a fixed number of columns and a variable number of rows. Since it uses a single array buffer, in terms of memory and computation, this data structure is more efficient than a jagged array of arrays, an array-list of array-lists, or an array-list of arrays.

      public ArrayMatrix(int rows, int columns)
      Initializes a new instance of the ArrayMatrix class.
      Parameters:
      rows - the initial number of rows
      columns - the fixed number of columns

  • Method Details

    • getRows

      public int getRows()
      Gets the number of rows in the matrix.
      Returns:
      the number of rows

    • getColumns

      public int getColumns()
      Gets the number of columns in the matrix.
      Returns:
      the number of columns

    • get

      public E get(int row, int column)
      Gets the element based on its row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - the zero-based index of the row, between 0 (inclusive) and the number of rows (exclusive)
      column - the zero-based index of the column, between 0 (inclusive) and the number of columns (exclusive)
      Returns:
      the element at the given row and column
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the row or column index is less than zero, the row index is greater than or equal to the number of rows, or the column index is greater than or equal to the number of columns

    • add

      public void add(E[] row)
      Adds a row to the matrix.
      Parameters:
      row - an array containing the elements to add whose length is equal to the number of columns
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the length of the row is not equal to the number of columns
